docs.snippet: Alphabet Inc's Google faces a tougher regulatory landscape as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration looks poised to reverse Obama administration policies that often favored the internet giant in the company's battles with tel...
docs.lead_paragraph: Alphabet Inc's Google faces a tougher regulatory landscape as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's incoming administration looks poised to reverse Obama administration policies that often favored the internet giant in the company's battles with telecoms and cable heavyweights, analysts say.

headline.main: Google, an Obama Ally, May Face Policy Setbacks Under Trump
headline.print_headline: Google, an Obama Ally, May Face Policy Setbacks Under Trump

docs.snippet: President-elect Donald Trump offered former military intelligence chief Michael Flynn the job of national security adviser as he began to build out his national security team Thursday, according to a senior Trump official. The move came as Trump m...
docs.lead_paragraph: President-elect Donald Trump offered former military intelligence chief Michael Flynn the job of national security adviser as he began to build out his national security team Thursday, according to a senior Trump official. The move came as Trump made his most direct foray into foreign policy since the election, meeting with Japan's prime minister.

headline.main: AP Source: Trump Offers Flynn National Security Adviser Job
headline.print_headline: AP Source: Trump Offers Flynn National Security Adviser Job

docs.snippet: Social media’s political sway is a given in places like the Philippines, Indonesia and Colombia, where false news often emerges to influence the vote....
docs.lead_paragraph: Social media’s political sway is a given in places like the Philippines, Indonesia and Colombia, where false news often emerges to influence the vote.
docs.abstract: Political leaders, advocacy groups and minorities worldwide demand transparency from social media networks, specifically Facebook, after several incidents in which serious misinformation was disseminated to millions of people; Facebook's role in presidential election in United States has thrown common use of social media status as primary news source into global spotlight.

headline.main: Fake News in U.S. Election? Elsewhere, That’s Nothing New
headline.print_headline: Leverage for Globe’s Gullible: Facebook’s Fake News Problem

byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong and Mark Scott from London.
byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and MARK SCOTT

docs.snippet: Politics intruded on this year’s awards ceremony, where Mr. Whitehead, whose novel explores the horrors of American slavery, urged writers to “fight the power.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Politics intruded on this year’s awards ceremony, where Mr. Whitehead, whose novel explores the horrors of American slavery, urged writers to “fight the power.”
docs.abstract: Colson Whitehead wins National Book Award for novel The Underground Railroad at ceremony held at Cipriani Wall Street in Manhattan; speeches at awards event refer to presidential election results with call for political action, reflection on role of artists during turbulent times and power of books to inspire empathy and understanding.

headline.main: Colson Whitehead Wins National Book Award for ‘The Underground Railroad’
headline.print_headline: A Heavy Heart May Have Caused Pluto to Turn Its Back, Studies Find
